events.message: The customer reported a car collision that happened on April 28, 2024, involving a rear-end accident at a traffic light.
Based on the accident description, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to damage to the vehicle and involved parties.
An agent experienced in auto insurance claims was assigned to the case to ensure swift handling of the accident claim.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer received confirmation of the claim registration and next steps.
Request sent to the customer for accident photos, police report, and repair estimates to facilitate claim investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, vehicle damage photos, and mechanic’s repair estimate.
Investigation on the collision details and liability began, focusing on reviewing submitted documents and accident circumstances.
After comprehensive review, the investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and damage was covered under policy.
A settlement offer was proposed covering vehicle repair costs and rental reimbursement according to the policy terms.
The customer responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for prompt claim handling.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer and review by the agent.
Payment for the vehicle repairs and rental reimbursement was issued promptly to the customer’s designated account.
The claim case was closed successfully after all obligations were met and the customer confirmed satisfaction with the outcome.
Claim files and all related documentation were archived in the company system for future reference and compliance audits.
